subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Letter for "er" as in earth?
msgSnippet: I m not familiar with Zuk s renaming of the letters . Is this in any of the documents on the Read_Alphabet group website? Thanks. Ted
messageBody:
I'm not familiar with "Zuk's renaming of the letters". Is this in any of the documents on the Read_Alphabet group website?

Thanks.

Ted


On 10/5/07, pgabhart <pgabhart@...> wrote:

No.  It should not look like a "D"..  The alternate letter connects the schwa and the "r" together as in Senior QS.  I am not sure at this time if anyone else has used Zuk's renaming of the letters, but you are certainly free to do so.  I liked them also.  Because of the frequent combining of vowels with a following "r" they can be combined in one connected form, and you will see these in Zuk's font.

I will respond to your earlier e-mail later.

Paige

Paul Tremblay wrote:

In looking at the excellent document written by John Zuk, I notice that
there is an optional symbol that represents the "er" sound as in
"Earth." On my web browser, this looks like a capital "D." Is this what
it is supposed to look like?

I really like Zuk's renaming of the letters. Do others use his convention?

Paul

PS The page appeared fine on my linux computer, but looking at the page
on a Mac computer, I am seeing boxes instead of characters. What font
was used? Am I missing the font on this machine? Is the encoding UTF8?
